etymologies: early 19th century: from French gélatine, from Italian gelatina, from gelata, from Latin (see jelly)

definitions: a virtually colorless and tasteless water-soluble protein prepared from collagen and used in food preparation as the basis of jellies, in photographic processes, and in glue.
shortDefinitions: virtually colorless and tasteless water-soluble protein prepared from collagen

definitions: a high explosive consisting chiefly of a gel of nitroglycerine with added cellulose nitrate.
shortDefinitions: high explosive consisting chiefly of gel of nitroglycerine with added cellulose nitrate
